meanings.definition: Tear or pull (something) quickly or forcibly away from something or someone.
meanings.sent1: She tried to rip the paper in half.
meanings.sent2: He accidentally ripped his shirt on a nail.
meanings.sent3: The wind was so strong that it could rip the hat off your head!
meanings.sent4: The news of the tragedy will rip through the small town.
meanings.sent5: The angry dog's bark seemed to rip through the silence of the night.

meanings.definition: A tear or hole made by ripping.
meanings.sent1: There was a small rip in the fabric of her dress.
meanings.sent2: He noticed a rip in the page of his notebook.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten left a rip in the curtain.
meanings.sent4: The rip in the painting seemed to reveal a hidden message.
meanings.sent5: The loud rip of the paper echoed in the quiet room.

meanings.sent1: The car will rip down the highway.
meanings.sent2: The athlete will rip through the finish line.
meanings.sent3: The excited child will rip through the pile of presents on Christmas morning.
meanings.sent4: The storm will rip across the open fields.
meanings.sent5: The rocket will rip through the atmosphere on its way to space.
